events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application online, indicating the need to cover medical expenses and some existing personal debt.
The application was categorised under personal loans due to keywords such as medical and debt found in the application details.
A loan officer experienced in personal loans was assigned to handle the case, preparing for the initial detailed review of the applicant's needs.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the submitted documents and the financial situation described by the applicant.
Additional documentation was requested, including recent pay slips, medical bills, and statements of outstanding debts for further verification.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including medical receipts and employer income proof, aiding progress toward approval.
A credit check was completed revealing a moderate credit score but no significant delinquencies or default history.
Risk assessment determined the loan application holds moderate risk due to current debt levels balanced by steady income.
A loan offer was presented to the applicant, outlining terms tailored to cover medical bills and debt consolidation at a moderate interest rate.
The applicant reviewed the offer and expressed satisfaction with the terms, requesting minor clarification on the repayment schedule.
The application was escalated to senior loan management to finalize approval after review of applicant's feedback and request details.
The personal loan was approved by senior management, confirming approval terms and preparing for disbursement to the applicant.
Funds were successfully transferred to the applicantâ€™s bank account to cover medical expenses and consolidate personal debts as planned.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant understands repayment schedules and to offer assistance with any further questions.
The loan application was formally closed after successful funding and follow-up, marking completion of all procedural requirements.
